paragraph.paragraph:
The Externals property page in the Configuration Properties folder contains contains a configurable property page for specifying include files (C/C++ header files) and object files (C/C++ *.obj and *.lib). The page is different in appearance and functionality to other property pages in the project Configuration Properties.
Note: Externals refer to calls into unmanaged code, which require the build.xmlcompile_unmanaged_codeCompile Unmanaged Code property to be set to Yes. If your code does not call any unmanaged code and you have deemed it appropriate to not compile the unmanaged code during a ../../../compiling_projects/index.xmlBuild, there is no need for you to configure your project's externals properties.

The externals property page is split vertically into two sections. The top section, labeled Include Paths is to be used to specify include paths for locating C/C++ header files (*.h). The bottom section, labeled Object/Library Files, is used to individually specify Visual C/C++ compiled object files (*.obj or *.lib).

To add an external either enter the location of the external in the provided external text field adjacent to the browse ellipse button (...). Alternative use the ellipse button to locate the external using the Windows browse dialogs. Using the ellipse buttons for Include Paths will present a folder browse dialog, whereas the Object/Library Files will present a file browse dialog. Using the browse dialogs will populate the text field with your selection.
After entering or selecting a desired external the corresponding Add button will become active. Click Add to add the specified external to the list of externals.
To remove an external simply select the external path or file to be remove and click the corresponding Remove button, located below the list of externals.

To make a modification to an external already present in a list, slow double-left mouse click (the same as renaming files in Microsoft Windows Explorer) on the external in the list to modify. A line editor will appear with the selected external highlighted. Make the desired adjustments and either click outside of the line editor or press Enter. Pressing Escape will discard any changes made and closes the line editor.
